articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 13th in B (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 13th in B (Shape: G)

## Brief Description  
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played individually rather than simultaneously. The 13th arpeggio in B utilizing the G shape involves playing the individual notes of a B 13th chord in the G position.

## Notes and Intervals  
The B 13th arpeggio in the G shape consists of the following notes and intervals:  
- B (root)
- C# (9th)
- D# (3rd)
- F# (13th)
- A# (7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor  
Arpeggios are commonly used in various genres of music such as jazz, classical, and rock. The B 13th arpeggio in the G shape can add a jazzy and sophisticated flair to a song. It provides a rich and full sound with its extended chord tones and can create a sense of tension and release within a musical context.

## Songs  
Three examples of songs that use the B 13th arpeggio in the G shape include:  
1. "Stella by Starlight" by Victor Young  
2. "All Blues" by Miles Davis  
3. "Someday My Prince Will Come" by Frank Churchill
